article.headline: Xavier 81, Coppin St 56
article.story: CINCINNATI (AP) -- Brian Thornton had 17 points and seven rebounds to lead Xavier to an 81-56 win over Coppin State on Tuesday. The reigning Atlantic-10 Player of the Week shot 6-for-7 from the field and made 5-of-6 from the free-throw line for Xavier (3-0), which held the Eagles to 37 percent shooting. Darryl Roberts and Tywain McKee scored 14 points apiece for Coppin State (0-5), which outrebounded the taller Musketeers 33-27. Thornton was hobbled for most of last season by tendinitis in his leg. He's fully recovered and has his shooting touch back -- 21-of-25 from the field in the first three games. Thornton converted a three-point play and Josh Duncan hit a 3-pointer in Xavier's 21-6 run to close out the first half. Thornton then scored six straight points to open the second half to help the Musketeers built a 41-23 lead. Stanley Burrell had 13 points, Dedrick Finn 12 and Duncan 10 for Xavier, which faces No. 12 Illinois on Saturday. Darryl Proctor had 12 points and six rebounds for Coppin State, which shot 12-of-24 from the free-throw line. The Musketeers shot 60 percent from the field against the Eagles and are connecting on 54 percent of their shots after three games. Defense was coach Sean Miller's main point of emphasis in the offseason. Xavier has held its first three opponents to 30.7 percent shooting from the field and 48.7 points per game.
